script.name: !move.movetostation.drone
script.description: Drone dock to ship. Drone is caught as a ware instead of traditional ship docking.
script.sourceplaintext:
skip if $target -> exists return FLRET_INVALIDPARMS skip if [THIS] -> is docking allowed at $target return FLRET_INVALIDPARMS
$wareDrone = [THIS] -> get ware type code of object $wareDrone = get catch ware type: ware=$wareDrone gosub sub.CheckCargoBay
$acc = [THIS] ->get current acceleration $speedMax = [THIS] -> get current max speed
$distToStop = $speedMax * $speedMax / ( 2 * $acc )
$range = $target -> get size of object $size = [THIS] -> get size of object $precision = $range $precision = get maximum, $range, 100, 0, 0, 0 $bufferCollision = $range + $size + ( $distToStop * 4 ) $bufferTimer = $range + $size + ( $distToStop * 8 ) $distToStop = $distToStop + 120 $rangeSmall = $range + $size + $distToStop $rangeBig = $range + $size + ( $distToStop * 6 / 5 )
$taskMove = null $taskCollision = null
$wrongWayMax = 8 $wrongWayCount = $wrongWayMax $distOld = 9999999
$return = null while [TRUE] skip if $target -> exists gosub sub.Return
if not [THIS] -> is in same sector as $target gosub sub.EndTasks $sec = $target -> get sector @ $ret = [THIS] -> call script !move.movetosector : sector=$sec do if $ret == FLRET_NOPATH return $ret @ = wait randomly from 100 to 200 ms continue end
* This check only required only for freight drones that may be docked at a station. if [DOCKEDAT] @ = [THIS] -> call script !move.undock : @ = wait randomly from 100 to 200 ms continue end
if not $target -> is in a sector @ = [THIS] -> move around 60000 ms @ = wait randomly from 100 to 200 ms continue end
skip if [THIS] -> is docking allowed at $target gosub sub.Return
gosub sub.CheckCargoBay
if [THIS] -> is in active sector if [THIS] -> find nearest enemy ship: max.dist=10000 $range = $rangeBig else * No collision set in drone.check means we can get closer to target ship, which looks better. $range = $rangeSmall end if $dist < $bufferCollision $wait = 250 else if $dist < $bufferTimer $wait = 1000 else $wait = 4000 end else $range = 300 $wait = 10000 end
$dist = get distance between [THIS] and $target do if $dist < $range break
$x = $target -> get x position $y = $target -> get y position $z = $target -> get z position if not [THIS] -> is script !move.movetopositioncontinue on stack of task=$taskMove gosub sub.MoveToPosition else if $xOld != $x OR $yOld != $y OR $zOld != $z gosub sub.MoveToPosition * tell carrier to stop moving do if $target -> is of class Moveable Ship @ = [THIS] -> call script !ship.signal.docking : Carrier=$target Docking?=[TRUE] else if [THIS] -> is in active sector if $dist > $distOld dec $wrongWayCount = if not $wrongWayCount $wrongWayCount = $wrongWayMax * Try to wake drone up from weird maneuver where it flies miles away from target before turning back gosub sub.MoveToPosition end end $distOld = $dist end @ = wait $wait ms end
gosub sub.EndTaskMove
* We made it, now to make docking look pretty if [THIS] -> is in active sector $speed = [THIS] -> get current speed if $speed > 5 skip if $taskMove $taskMove = [THIS] -> get next available task: starting=[Task.StartFree] [THIS] ->start task $taskMove with script !move.movetoposition and prio 100: arg1=[SECTOR] arg2=$x arg3=$y arg4=$z arg5=$precision $wait = 1000 * $speed / $acc @ = wait $wait ms [THIS] ->start task $taskMove with script !lib.interrupt and prio 100: arg1=null arg2=null arg3=null arg4=null arg5=null $i = 20 while $i $speed = [THIS] -> get current speed do if $speed < 15 break dec $i = @ = wait 400 ms end [THIS] ->set ship speed to 0 end @ = wait 100 ms [THIS] ->set ship speed to 0 $x = [THIS] -> get x position $y = [THIS] -> get y position $z = [THIS] -> get z position if $size > 10 @ START null -> call script !lib.effect.spawn : =189 =$x =$y =$z =2000 @ = wait 400 ms else @ START null -> call script !lib.effect.spawn : =184 =$x =$y =$z =1300 @ = wait 150 ms end
skip if $target -> exists gosub sub.Return end
gosub sub.CheckCargoBay
* Now we can actually dock. $amount = $target -> get true amount of ware $wareDrone in cargo bay $wareObj = [THIS] ->undeploy to flying ware $result = $target -> catch ware object $wareObj $amount2 = $target -> get true amount of ware $wareDrone in cargo bay
* backup if undeploy and catch ware commands refuse to play nice. if $amount2 != ( $amount + 1 ) if $amount == $amount2 = [THIS] -> add 1 units of $wareDrone else $amount = -1 * ( $amount2 - $amount - 1 ) = [THIS] -> add $amount units of $wareDrone end end
if [THIS] -> is of class Freight Drone $wares = [THIS] ->get wares table: include equipped=[FALSE] if size of table $wares $task = $target -> get next available task: starting=[Task.StartFree] * Start task on target because drone has just ceased to exist $target ->start task $task with script !lib.freight.transfer.or.eject and prio 100: arg1=$wares arg2=null arg3=null arg4=null arg5=null end end
$return = FLRET_LANDED gosub sub.Return
* ================= * Return * ================= sub.Return: gosub sub.EndTasks return $return endsub
* ================= * Move to position * ================= sub.MoveToPosition: skip if $taskMove $taskMove = [THIS] -> get next available task: starting=[Task.StartFree] [THIS] ->start task $taskMove with script !move.movetopositioncontinue and prio 100: arg1=[SECTOR] arg2=$x arg3=$y arg4=$z arg5=50 $xOld = $x $yOld = $y $zOld = $z
* Start parallel task to check when drone is close to target to disable collision if not [THIS] -> is script !move.movetostation.drone.check on stack of task=$taskCollision $taskCollision = [THIS] -> get next available task: starting=[Task.StartFree] [THIS] ->start task $taskCollision with script !move.movetostation.drone.check and prio 100: arg1=$target arg2=$bufferCollision arg3=$taskMove arg4=null arg5=null end endsub
* ================= * End tasks * ================= sub.EndTasks: gosub sub.EndTaskMove if $taskCollision if [THIS] ->is named script '!move.movetostation.drone.check' on stack of task=$taskCollision [THIS] ->start task $taskCollision with script !lib.interrupt and prio 100: arg1=null arg2=null arg3=null arg4=null arg5=null [THIS] ->ignore collisions: [FALSE] end end * remove ship from docking array if $target -> exists do if $target -> is of class Moveable Ship @ = [THIS] -> call script !ship.signal.docking : Carrier=$target Docking?=[FALSE] end endsub
* ================= * End task move * ================= sub.EndTaskMove: if $taskMove if [THIS] ->is named script '!move.movetopositioncontinue' on stack of task=$taskMove [THIS] ->start task $taskMove with script !lib.interrupt and prio 100: arg1=null arg2=null arg3=null arg4=null arg5=null else if [THIS] ->is named script '!move.movetoposition' on stack of task=$taskMove [THIS] ->start task $taskMove with script !lib.interrupt and prio 100: arg1=null arg2=null arg3=null arg4=null arg5=null end end endsub
* ================= * Check target ship has enough free space in cargo bay for a drone. * ================= sub.CheckCargoBay: if not $target -> get free amount of ware $wareDrone in cargo bay $return = FLRET_NOCARGO gosub sub.Return end endsub return null

line.text: get ware type code of object

comment.var: This check only required only for freight drones that may be docked at a station.
No collision set in drone.check means we can get closer to target ship, which looks better.
Try to wake drone up from weird maneuver where it flies miles away from target before turning back
We made it, now to make docking look pretty
backup if undeploy and catch ware commands refuse to play nice.
Start task on target because drone has just ceased to exist
Start parallel task to check when drone is close to target to disable collision
Check target ship has enough free space in cargo bay for a drone.
